<h3 id="X3068">X(3068)&nbsp;=&nbsp;INTERSECTION OF X(2)X(6) AND X(4)X(371)</h3>
Trilinears &nbsp;&nbsp; sin A + sin B sin C : :
<br>
Trilinears &nbsp;&nbsp; (S + a<sup>2</sup>)/a : :
<br>
Trilinears &nbsp;&nbsp; cos A + sin A + cos B cos C : :
<br>
Barycentrics &nbsp;&nbsp; (sin A)(sin A + sin B sin C) : :
<br>
Barycentrics &nbsp;&nbsp; a<sup>2</sup> + S : :
<br>
Barycentrics &nbsp;&nbsp; SB + SC + S : :
<p>
X(3068): Let A'B'C' be the outer Vecten triangle.  Let A" be the trilinear pole of line B'C', and define B", C" cyclically.  The lines AA", BB", CC" concur in X(3068).  (Randy Hutson, July 21, 2017)
</p>
<p>
X(3068) lies on these lines: {1,1336}, {2,6}, {3,1587}, {4,371}, {5,1588}, {8,7969}, {9,5393}, {10,13893}, {11,13895}, {12,13896}, {13,13917}, {14,13916}, {17,22921}, {18,22876}, {19,1659}, {20,1151}, {19051,20304}, {19084,22966}, {19174,19183}, {19420,19436}, {19421,19438}, {22466,22976}, {22555,22960}
</p>
<p>
X(3068) = isogonal conjugate of X(493)<br>
X(3068) = complement of X(1270)<br>
X(3068) = X(i)-Ceva conjugate of X(j) for these (i,j): (393,3069), (1585,4)<br>
X(3068) = crosspoint of X(2) and X(1131)<br>
X(3068) = crosssum of X(6) and X(1151)<br>
X(3068) = {X(2),X(6)}-harmonic conjugate of X(3069)<br>
X(3068) = X(2)-of-1st-tri-squares-triangle<br>
X(3068) = X(2)-of-1st-tri-squares-central-triangle<br>
X(3068) = orthologic center of these triangles: 1st tri-squares to outer-Vecten<br>
X(3068) = homothetic center of ABC and 3rd tri-squares central triangle<br>
</p>
<p></p>
